definition: animal hide/leather/to reform/to remove/to expel (from office)

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: 11-13 This is a matter which has been too little considered, both by moralists and by social reformers.
sentences.chinese: 在这件事上，道德家和社会改革家都考虑得太少了。

sentences.english: He deserves to be called a great reformer.
sentences.chinese: 他称得起一位伟大的改革家。

sentences.english: Her father was an educator and social reformer.
sentences.chinese: 她父亲是教育家兼社会改革家。

sentences.english: Wang Anshi is a famous reformer in the Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 王安石是北宋著名的改革家。

sentences.english: The politician was a famous social reformer .
sentences.chinese: 那位政治家曾是著名的社会改革家。

sentences.english: Tan Sitong was an outstanding social reformer at the end of the Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 谭嗣同是清末杰出的社会改革家。

sentences.english: This is a matter which has been too little considered, both by moralists and by social reformers.
sentences.chinese: 在这件事上，道德家和社会改革家都考虑得太少了。

definition: to change the laws/political reform/unconventional method
important official or statesman (in feudal China)
famous prime minister (in ancient China)/names and appearances (Buddhism)
